intro: Drymonia, commonly known as the fairy lantern, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. They typically grow in acidic soils and are often found in forested areas or rocky habitats. Drymonia species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens.
